intro: Telogyne indica, commonly known as the Indian telogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds. Telogyne indica is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
